instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S4RS3: What is PP5V_S4RS3? PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) shitty logic board again Why WHY
threads.message: Now board was water damaged around <CHIP>U3220</CHIP> ,cleaned ,replaced now when connect board with charger green light and orange but no spin <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.5  V,PPVRTC  3.3V ,<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> 5V missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4RS3</SIGNAL>  ,now when I connect battery and charger macbook chime and start (working) once when started I can disconnect battery and its still will work ,so to turn on needs battery connected ?????

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) shitty logic board again Why WHY
threads.message: Lol I literally had the same problem last week! If it recognizes, charges, and runs off of the battery, I'd leave it.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) shitty logic board again Why WHY
threads.message: I only notice without battery that <CAPACITOR>C7126</CAPACITOR> <SIGNAL>CHGR_BGATE</SIGNAL>  voltage is fluctuating from 8.5V and 1.2V  ,with battery is stable 8.5V

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) shitty logic board again Why WHY
threads.message: Resistance betwenn pins 17-18 and 27-28 from <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>?? Voltage on pin 2?? Only charger...

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) shitty logic board again Why WHY
threads.message: Resistance between 27-28 is 21omh and 17-18 is 4omh and voltage on pin 2 is 19.6v using 85w magsafe

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) shitty logic board again Why WHY
threads.message: Did you check <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> in both cases? Maybe something wrong with <DIODE>D7005</DIODE> and/or resistors close by.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook Air 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) shitty logic board again Why WHY
[SOLVED]Macbook Air 13 (<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>) shitty logic board again Why WHY
threads.message: Why mess with it further if it works fine if there is a battery connected? Just leave it.
